                    ### Question
                    Which of the following is the best-known metabolic function of the lung

                    ### Options
                    opa. Inactivation of serotonin
opb. Conversion of angiotensin–I to angiotensin–II
opc. Inactivation of bradykinin
opd. Metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P–450 system

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The lungs play a significant role in various metabolic functions. The best-known metabolic function of the lungs is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II, which is crucial for blood pressure regulation. This process is facilitated by the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) located in the pulmonary endothelium. Inactivation of bradykinin also occurs in the lungs, contributing to the regulation of vascular tone, but it is less prominent than the angiotensin conversion. The inactivation of serotonin and the metabolism of basic drugs by the cytochrome P-450 system are recognized but are not as central to lung function as the angiotensin conversion. Therefore, the most consensus-supported metabolic function of the lung is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II.
